channel.title: CyberNetSec - Threat Actor
channel.description: Latest threat actor threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Safepay Ransomware Hits German Surveillance Firm Xortec, Sparking Supply Chain Fears
item.description:
The Safepay ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Xortec GmbH, a German provider of professional video surveillance solutions. The group has listed Xortec on its data leak site with a payment deadline of October 27, 2025. This attack raises significant supply chain co...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Supply Chain Attack, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Nation-State and Financial Cybercrime Blur as Industrial Sector Becomes Top Target
item.description:
A new report from Trellix reveals a significant convergence between the tactics of nation-state actors and financially motivated cybercriminals, with both increasingly leveraging AI-powered tools. The industrial sector has emerged as the most targeted industry, accounting for over 36% of attacks ana...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Intelligence, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticat...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, lever...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Read Full Article →

item.title: Chinese APT Salt Typhoon Targets European Telecom with SNAPPYBEE Backdoor
item.description:
The Chinese state-sponsored group Salt Typhoon has been observed targeting a European telecommunications firm by exploiting a known Citrix NetScaler vulnerability for initial access. Post-exploitation, the attackers deployed a backdoor known as SNAPPYBEE (or Deed RAT) using DLL side-loading techniqu...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Russian APT COLDRIVER Rapidly Deploys New NOROBOT Malware After Public Disclosure
item.description:
The Russian state-sponsored threat group COLDRIVER, also known as Star Blizzard and UNC4057, has demonstrated remarkable operational agility by deploying new malware families just five days after its LOSTKEYS malware was publicly disclosed in May 2025. According to Google's Threat Intelligence Group...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Malware, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: 'Cavalry Werewolf' APT Targets Russian Critical Infrastructure with Custom Malware
item.description:
The Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as Cavalry Werewolf (also tracked as YoroTrooper and Silent Lynx) conducted a targeted cyberattack campaign against Russia's public sector and critical industries between May and August 2025. The group leveraged spear-phishing emails to deliver custom...

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Read Full Article →

item.title: Clop Ransomware Claims Harvard University Breach, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The prolific Russian-speaking ransomware group Clop has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Harvard University, adding the prestigious institution to its data leak site on October 12, 2025. The group, known for its 'big-game hunting' and exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities, threate...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

item.title: F5 Breached by Nation-State Actor; BIG-IP Source Code Stolen, CISA Issues Emergency Directive
item.description:
Application security vendor F5 has disclosed a major security breach attributed to a 'highly sophisticated nation-state threat actor.' The attackers maintained long-term access to F5's internal development environments, exfiltrating portions of the BIG-IP source code, information on undisclosed vuln...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Threat Actor
